required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dry Needling of Scalene Muscle Trigger Points in Mechanical Neck Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Dry Needling of Active Trigger Points in the Scalene Muscles on Individuals With Mechanical Neck Pain

brief_summary.textblock: There is preliminary evidence suggesting that referred pain from active trigger points can play a relevant role in individuals with mechanical neck pain. Some studies have investigated the effectiveness of dry needling over the upper trapezius muscle in this population. However, other muscles, such as the scalene muscles, can be also relevant for neck pain symptoms. No study has investigated the effects of the application of dry needling over active trigger points in the scalenes muscles in a sample of patients with mechanical neck pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in neck pain intensity with a numerical pain rate scale before and after the intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one day (immediately post), 7 days (one week) and 30 days (one month) after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: A Numerical Pain Rate Scale (NPRS, 0-10) will be used to assess spontaneous neck pain intensity

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in oxigen saturation with a pulse oximeter before and after the intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one day (immediately post), 7 days (one week) and 30 days (one month) after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation will be monitored with a handheld pulse oximeter with Masimo SET® measure-through Motion and Low Perfusion™ pulse oximeter

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in inspiratory vital capacity with an incentive spirometer before and after the intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, one day (immediately post), 7 days (one week) and 30 days (one month) after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in inspiratory vital capacity will be assessed with the incentive spirometer DHD Coach 2®

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in neck-related disability with the Neck Disability Index before and after the intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 7 days (one week) and 30 days (one month) after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The Neck Disability Index (NDI, 0-50), a specific neck pain related disability questionaire, will be used for assessing neck pain related-disability

arm_group.description: Patients will receive dry needling over active trigger points in the scalene muscles
Patients will receive a manual compression for 30seconds over active trigger points in the scalene muscles

intervention.description: A solid filiform needle will be inserted over active trigger points in the scalene muscles for 30 seconds. The aim will be to elicit local twitch responses or the referred pain pattern of the scalene muscles.
The therapist will apply manual compression over active trigger points in the scalene muscles for 30 seconds
